name: Tamura Texture Features
description: Extracts perceptual texture features (coarseness, contrast, directionality) to identify unnatural texture characteristics typical of AI-generated images.
mechanism: Computes Tamura coarseness by analyzing local average differences at multiple scales, and directionality by computing gradient orientation histograms. AI images tend to have lower coarseness and more isotropic gradient distributions.
parameters: Scales: 5 levels (2^1 to 2^5), Gradient: Sobel operator, Orientation bins: 16
accuracy: Moderate — 65-78%, best as complementary texture signal
source: Tamura, H. et al. (1978) — Textural Features Corresponding to Visual Perception, IEEE SMC
useCase: Detecting unnatural texture properties in AI-generated surfaces and materials

references.title: Tamura, H. et al. (1978). Textural Features Corresponding to Visual Perception. IEEE SMC.

strengths:
• Perceptually meaningful features
• Captures texture at multiple scales
• Independent of image content
• Fast computation
limitations:
• Lower standalone accuracy
• Sensitive to image resolution
• May overlap with other texture methods
• AI improving at texture generation
